basics.name: Alice Petrov
basics.summary: PhD student, interested in the intersection of computer science and pure mathematics, focusing on geometric data processing, topological data analysis, and geometric deep learning.

education.area: Mathematics and Foundations of Computer Science

meta.dissertation: Persistent Homology for the Analysis of Stratified Spaces

meta.thesis: An Algebraic Model of Planning Problems

work.name: Smith Institute
work.summary: Applied mathematical modelling and machine learning for energy systems; built MLOps architectures for data pipelines and model deployment.
highlights: Optimized balancing of the UK National Grid
Designed MLOps patterns for robust deployment

work.name: University of Oxford
work.summary: Applied persistent homology to stratified data; developed computational pipelines to analyze structure in word embeddings.
highlights: Used persistent/intersection homology and bifiltrations for singularity analysis
Revealed structural differences across dimensionality-reduction techniques

work.name: Queen's University, MuLab
work.summary: Explored semigroup-theoretic models for AI planning and automated theorem proving.
highlights: Studied representations/transformations of state spaces via semigroups
Connected automated planning with automated theorem proving

work.name: Queen's University, RISE Lab
work.summary: Analyzed robustness of open-source ecosystems and automated code-snippet recommendation.
highlights: Modeled OSS ecosystems with ecological networks
Cut data-collection time by ~90% using GitHub API, Requests, and multiprocessing

work.name: Queen's University, RISE Lab
work.summary: Built classifiers for reusable code snippets from Jupyter notebooks.
highlights: Developed single- and multi-label models with NLTK, Keras, scikit-learn, TensorFlow

work.name: State Street
work.summary: Contributed to public cloud infrastructure: logging, compliance, and internal libraries.
highlights: Python, AWS Lambda, DynamoDB, SNS, Kinesis, PingFederate, REST APIs, CI/CD

work.name: Ontario Teachers' Pension Plan
work.summary: Automation and analytics in Java; built data pipelines for ongoing departmental use.
highlights: Automated daily data wrangling and visualization tasks

awards.summary: Financial support for high-calibre doctoral students in natural sciences and engineering.

awards.summary: Awarded to student with high standing in Math/Stats courses entering 4th year.

awards.summary: 4x First, 3x Second, 1x Third across nine tracks for PARIS system.

awards.title: Nellie & Ralph Jeffery Award in Mathematics
Nan Skelding Scholarship
awards.summary: Awarded on academic excellence to female students entering third year in Math & Stats.

awards.title: Dean's Honour List with Distinction
awards.summary: Top 3% of students in B.Sc. and B.Comp degree programs.

awards.summary: Entrance scholarship based on academic excellence.

volunteer.organization: Oxford Womxn in Computer Science Society (OxWoCS)
volunteer.summary: Managed a team of five to run outreach initiatives.
highlights: Gender Equity in STEM (GenSTEM) Conference organization

volunteer.summary: Developed and delivered CS lectures for Year 9 students.

highlights: Oxford Maths Festival: interactive Sphero programming sessions
Oxford Online Maths Club: workshops for 6th form students

projects.name: LOGML Summer School
projects.summary: Evaluated invariant ML methods; built permutation-invariant attention network using less training data for detecting terminal singularities in toric varieties.
